summary: This bill, introduced by Mr. Lawler, is the "Coordinated Counterterrorism Act." It amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to broaden the scope of U.S. funding for counterterrorism efforts. The amendment allows the Department of State's counterterrorism bureau to provide assistance to counterterrorism-focused military and intelligence units in foreign countries. It also specifies that this assistance can include information sharing with U.S. law enforcement agencies.
